column2: Stranger, more thrilling even than had been the flight of the Earth after being forced out of its orbit, was the flight of those dozen aircars of the Moon, bearing the rebels of Dalis' Gens back to Earth.
column3: Stranger, more thrilling even than had been the flight of the Earth after being forced out of its orbit, was the flight of those dozen aircars of the Moon, bearing the rebels of Dalis' Gens back to Earth.

column2: For the light which glowed from the bodies of the rebels, which had been given them by their passage through the white flames, was transmitted to the cars themselves, so that they glowed as with an inner radiance of their own--like comets flashing across the night.

column2: Strange alchemy, which Sarka wondered about and, wondering, looked ahead to the time when he should be able, within his laboratory, to analyze the force it embodied, and thus gain new scientific knowledge of untold value to people of the Earth.

column2: That there was an alliance between Mars and the Moon seemed almost unbelievable.
column3: That there was an alliance between Mars and the Moon seemed almost unbelievable.

column2: How had they managed the first contact, the first negotiations leading to the compact between two such alien peoples?
column3: How had they managed the first contact, the first negotiations leading to the compact between two such alien peoples?

column2: Had there been any flights exchanged by the two worlds, surely the scientists of Earth would have known about it.
column3: Had there been any flights exchanged by the two worlds, surely the scientists of Earth would have known about it.

column2: But there had not, though there had been times and times when Sarka had peered closely enough at the surface of both the Moon and of Mars to see the activities, or the results of the activities, of the peoples of the two worlds.
column3: But there had not, though there had been times and times when Sarka had peered closely enough at the surface of both the Moon and of Mars to see the activities, or the results of the activities, of the peoples of the two worlds.

column2: Somehow, however, communication, if Sarka the Second had guessed correctly, had been managed between Mars and the Moon; and now that the Earth was a free flying orb the two were in alliance against it, perhaps for the same reason that the Earth had gone a-voyaging.

column2: Side by side sat Sarka and Jaska, their eager eyes peering through the forward end of the flashing aircar toward the Earth, growing minute by minute larger.
column3: Side by side sat Sarka and Jaska, their eager eyes peering through the forward end of the flashing aircar toward the Earth, growing minute by minute larger.

column2: They were able, after some hours, to make out the outlines of what had once been continents, to see the shadows in valleys which had once held the oceans of Earth....
column3: They were able, after some hours, to make out the outlines of what had once been continents, to see the shadows in valleys which had once held the oceans of Earth....

column2: And always, as they stared and literally willed the cubes which piloted and were the motive power of the aircars to speed and more speed, that marvelous display of interplanetary fireworks which had aroused the concern of Sarka the Second.
column3: And always, as they stared and literally willed the cubes which piloted and were the motive power of the aircars to speed and more speed, that marvelous display of interplanetary fireworks which had aroused the concern of Sarka the Second.

column2: What were those lights?
column3: What were those lights?

column2: Whence did they emanate?
column3: Whence did they emanate?

column2: Sarka the Second had said that they came from Mars, yet Mars was invisible to those in the speeding aircars, which argued that it was hidden behind the Earth. There was no way of knowing how close it was to the home of these rebels of Dalis' Gens.

column2: And ever, as they flashed forward, Sarka was recalling that vague hint on the lips of Jaska, to the effect that Luar, for all her sovereignty of the Moon, might be, nonetheless, a native of the Earth.

column2: But....
column3: But....

column2: How?
column3: How?

column2: Why?
column3: Why?

column2: When?
column3: When?

column2: There were no answers to any of the questions yet.
column3: There were no answers to any of the questions yet.

column2: If she were a native of Earth, how had she reached the Moon?
column3: If she were a native of Earth, how had she reached the Moon?

column2: Who was she?
column3: Who was she?

column2: Her name, Luar, was a strange one, and Sarka studied it for many minutes, rolling the odd syllables of it over his tongue, wondering where, on the Earth, he had heard names, or words, similar to it.
column3: Her name, Luar, was a strange one, and Sarka studied it for many minutes, rolling the odd syllables of it over his tongue, wondering where, on the Earth, he had heard names, or words, similar to it.

column2: This produced no result, until he tried substituting various letters; then, again, adding various letters.
column3: This produced no result, until he tried substituting various letters; then, again, adding various letters.

column2: His mind went back to the clucking sounds which, among the Gnomes of the Moon, passed for speech.
column3: His mind went back to the clucking sounds which, among the Gnomes of the Moon, passed for speech.

column2: He pondered anew.
column3: He pondered anew.

column2: Yes, Jaska, he said suddenly, "somewhere on Earth, when we reach it, we may discover the secret of Luar--and know far more about Dalis than we have ever known before!"
column3: Yes, Jaska, he said suddenly, "somewhere on Earth, when we reach it, we may discover the secret of Luar-and know far more about Dalis than we have ever known before!"

column2: By intuition, she already knew.
column3: By intuition, she already knew.

column2: Let Sarka arrive at her conclusion by scientific methods if he desired, and she would simply smile anew.
column3: Let Sarka arrive at her conclusion by scientific methods if he desired, and she would simply smile anew.

column2: Sarka thought of the manner in which Jaska and he had been transported to the Moon; of how much Dalis seemed to know of the secrets of the laboratory of the Sarkas.
column3: Sarka thought of the manner in which Jaska and he had been transported to the Moon; of how much Dalis seemed to know of the secrets of the laboratory of the Sarkas.

column2: Might he not have known, two centuries ago, of the Secret Exit Dome, and somehow managed to make use of it in some ghastly experiment?

column2: And still the one question remained unanswered: Who was Luar?
column3: And still the one question remained unanswered: Who was Luar?

column2: The Earth was now so close that details were plainly seen.
column3: The Earth was now so close that details were plainly seen.

column2: The Himalayas were out of sight, over the Earth, and by a mental command Sarka managed to change slightly the course of the dozen aircars.
column3: The Himalayas were out of sight, over the Earth, and by a mental command Sarka managed to change slightly the course of the dozen aircars.

column2: In their flight, which had been, to them a flight through the glories of a super-heavenly Universe, they had lost all count of time.
column3: In their flight, which had been, to them a flight through the glories of a super heavenly Universe, they had lost all count of time.

column2: Neither Sarka nor Jaska, nor yet the people in those other aircars, could have told how long they had been flying, when, coming over the curve of the Earth, at an elevation of something like three miles, they were able at last to see into the area which had once housed the Gens of Dalis.
column3: Neither Sarka nor Jaska, nor yet the people in those other aircars, could have told how long they had been flying, when, coming over the curve of the Earth, at an elevation of something like three miles, they were able at last to see into the area which had once housed the Gens of Dalis.

column2: The Gens of Dalis had occupied all the territory northward to the Pole, from a line drawn east and west through the southernmost of what had once been the Hawaiian Islands.
column3: The Gens of Dalis had occupied all the territory northward to the Pole, from a line drawn east and west through the southernmost of what had once been the Hawaiian Islands.

column2: Upon this area had struck the strange blue light from the deep Cone of the Moon.
column3: Upon this area had struck the strange blue light from the deep Cone of the Moon.

column2: Here, however, the light was invisible, and Sarka flew on in fear that somehow his aircars would blunder into it, and be destroyed--for that the blue light was an agent of ghastly destruction became instantly apparent.
column3: Here, however, the light was invisible, and Sarka flew on in fear that somehow his aircars would blunder into it, and be destroyed-for that the blue light was an agent of ghastly destruction became instantly apparent.

column2: The dwellings of the Gens of Dalis were broken and smashed into chaotic ruins.
column3: The dwellings of the Gens of Dalis were broken and smashed into chaotic ruins.

column2: For, in order for the Gens of Dalis to be in position to launch their attack against the Moon, he had managed, by manipulating the speed of the Beryls, to bring that area into position directly opposite the Moon.
column3: For, in order for the Gens of Dalis to be in position to launch their attack against the Moon, he had managed, by manipulating the speed of the Beryls, to bring that area into position directly opposite the Moon.

column2: Had it been otherwise, the blue column might have struck anywhere, and wiped out millions of lives!
column3: Had it been otherwise, the blue column might have struck anywhere, and wiped out millions of lives!

column2: God, Jaska, murmured Sarka.
column3: God, Jaska, murmured Sarka.

column2: Look!
column3: Look!

column2: Think of a shoreline, once lined with mighty buildings, after the passage of a tidal wave greater than ever before known to man.
column3: Think of a shoreline, once lined with mighty buildings, after the passage of a tidal wave greater than ever before known to man.

column2: The devastation would be indescribable.
column3: The devastation would be indescribable.

column2: Multiply that shoreline by the vast area which had housed the Gens of Dalis, and the mental picture is almost too big to grasp.
column3: Multiply that shoreline by the vast area which had housed the Gens of Dalis, and the mental picture is almost too big to grasp.

column2: Chaos, catastrophe, approaching an infinity of destruction.
column3: Chaos, catastrophe, approaching an infinity of destruction.

column2: Yet, Sarka knew, remembering the murmuring of the blue column as it came out of the cone, all this devastation had been caused in almost absolute silence.
column3: Yet, Sarka knew, remembering the murmuring of the blue column as it came out of the cone, all this devastation had been caused in almost absolute silence.

column2: People could have watched and seen these deserted buildings slowly fuse together, run together as molten metal runs together, like the lava from a volcano of long ago under the ponderous moving to and fro of some invisible, juggernautlike agency.
column3: People could have watched and seen these deserted buildings slowly fuse together, run together as molten metal runs together, like the lava from a volcano of long ago under the ponderous moving to and fro of some invisible, juggernautlike agency.

column2: Sarka shuddered, trying to picture in his mind the massing of the minions of Mars, who thus saw a new country given into their hands--if they could take it.
column3: Sarka shuddered, trying to picture in his mind the massing of the minions of Mars, who thus saw a new country given into their hands-if they could take it.

column2: Had the Earth been taken by surprise?
column3: Had the Earth been taken by surprise?

column2: Had Sarka the Second been able to prepare for the approaching catastrophe?
column3: Had Sarka the Second been able to prepare for the approaching catastrophe?

column2: Father, he sent his thoughts racing on ahead of him, "are those lights which are striking the Earth causing any damage?"
column3: Father, he sent his thoughts racing on ahead of him, "are those lights which are striking the Earth causing any damage?"

column2: Only, came back the instant answer, "in that they destroy the courage of the people of the Earth!
column3: Only, came back the instant answer, "in that they destroy the courage of the people of the Earth!

column2: The people, however, now know that Sarka is returning, and their courage rises again!
column3: The people, however, now know that Sarka is returning, and their courage rises again!

column2: The flames are merely a hint of what faces us; but the people will rise and follow you wherever you lead!"
column3: The flames are merely a hint of what faces us; but the people will rise and follow you wherever you lead!"

column2: So, as they raced across the area of devastation, the face of Sarka became calm again.
column3: So, as they raced across the area of devastation, the face of Sarka became calm again.

column2: On a chance, he sent a single sentence of strange meaning to his father.
column3: On a chance, he sent a single sentence of strange meaning to his father.

column2: The ruler of the Moon is a woman called Luar, which seems a contraction of Lunar!
column3: The ruler of the Moon is a woman called Luar, which seems a contraction of Lunar!

column2: For many minutes Sarka the Second made no answer.
